fields.headline: Today at the World Championships
fields.bodyText: DON'T MISS Dwain Chambers (Men's 100 metres final) There has never been such an open 100m in these championships, but the hope is that Dwain Chambers, after a season's best 10.03sec yesterday, can unearth a 9.87 like the one he ran at the Stade de France a year ago. And there is hope also for a golden swansong from Jonathan Edwards, competing in the triple jump for the last time. Afternoon session 5.0 Men's hammer final 5.25 Women's pole vault final 5.50 Men's high jump final 6.05 Men's 100m semi-final 6.20 Women's 100m hurdles heats 6.55 Men's triple jump final 7.05 Women's 400m hurdles semi-final 7.20 Women's discus final 7.35 Women's 400m semi-final 8.05 Men's 1500m semi-final 8.30 Women's 100m hurdles quarter-final 9.10 Men's 100m final TODAY'S WEATHER Mostly sunny, 31C (80F), with a very small chance of some rain
